item.title: VSAM record count using File-Aid
item.description: Whats the best way to count the number of records in a VSAM File? Choose FILE-AID Option 3.8. At the prompt of ….ENTER NEXT FUNCTION OR END , enter TALLY. You will get the record count. Type END to exit.

item.title: Find bad data using File-Aid
item.description: The Easiest and Coolest way to locate bad data is thru File-Aid’s FIND command. OPEN the file in FILE-AID (in either browse or edit mode). XREF with COPYBOOK. Use FMT mode. Then issue the below command. F /field-name INVALID or F /field-number INVALID The control will take you to the first invalid data record for the given field. Example: The FILE has 3 fields namely NAME,AGE,COUNTRY.

item.title: Copy a Dataset using File-Aid
item.description:
The steps to copy a file using File-Aid are :
Go to TSO/ISPF Open fileaid giving command as per your shop’s configuration Once FileAid’s Primary Option Menu is opened Choose Utilities Choose Copy Give source PDS/dataset name (in FROM ) you might need to provide volume serial number if it is not cataloged. Give destination PDS/dataset name (in TO) you might need to provide volume serial number if it is not cataloged.
